p: On 21 March 2020, a 50-year-old Caucasian man was referred to the emergency department with a 2-day history of fever and sore throat. He also had constitutional symptoms including myalgia, rhinorrhoea, cough and headache. His medical history was otherwise significant for chronic kidney disease, hypertension and hepatitis B (HBV). He was being treated with candesartan/hydrochlorothiazide and entecavir.
